result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on January 13, 2023 at 01:30 pm.

10:26 AM; Case called for Plea hearing.  Defendant Juan Rodriguez in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Tyler Luening in court for Juan Rodriguez.  Attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for State of Wisconsin. Court notes a plea questionnaire has been filed and this Court will hear the plea only and the matter will be set over for sentencing before Branch 2.  State and Defense confirm.  Court recites the offer as listed on the plea questionnaire.  State and Defense confirm the offer.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant requests a moment to review the plea questionnaire with his attorney again.  Court allows time for the defendant and his attorney to go over the plea questionnaire.  Court continues with the plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 7, 8 & 12, Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 7, 8 & 12.  Court orders Counts 9-11 & 13-16 be dismissed and read in.  Court will adjourn for sentencing before the Judge assigned to the case.  Court will also cancel the 11/17/2022 Jury status and 11/29/2022 Jury trial dates.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 13, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Plea hearing on October 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

State has complied with victim's rights.

to for Video or Phone Appearance for 7/28 Scheduling conference filed by Atty. Matthew Luening.

Scheduling conference on July 27, 2022 at 04:00 pm.  **Scheduling error; reset for 7/28.**
Hearing on July 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.  **Rescheduled due to Jury Trial.**

**COURT MODIFIES THE AMOUNT OF CASH BOND DOWN TO $50,000 FROM $75,000 WITH THE SAME CONDITIONS.**

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with victims A-E/witness A-D/individuals in the vehicle at the time of the alleged offense/Jeremy Rodriguez/co-actor listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.   Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.   Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within .5 mile of Jeremy Rodriguez, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release. Defendant to surrender their passport to the Waukesha Criminal Traffic Office (Room C226) within 24 hours of release from custody.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.   Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.   Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court.

State has complied with victim's rights.
Defense has received all of discovery from prior counsel.
Defense filed a motion to modify bail. 
Defense makes arguments on the record.
Court lowers cash bond to $50,000 with the same conditions. 
Parties to bring availability to set case for trial to the next hearing.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
Request for Substitution against Judge Jennifer Dorow, received on today's date. Filed by Atty Justin Griffis.

  **Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 02/22/22--Approved.**

**02/22/22 per the Court:  Upon further review, the approval of the request for substitution of Judge was premature.  Under the statute, both codefendants must make a timely request.  For now the case remains assigned to Branch 2 and upon a timely request for substitution from the codefendant, the Court will re-review the matter.**
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

08:26 AM Defendant Juan Rodriguez in court, in custody, with attorney Justin G Griffis.   Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Date to be set by newly assigned Judge.
